maqras.text: And We brought the Children of Israel across the sea; and Pharaoh and his hosts pursued them with spite and hostility until when drowning overtook him, he exclaimed, "I believe that there is no Allah but He in whom the children of Israel believe, and
What! Now! But a little while before were you in rebellion, and were of those who do evil
But this day shall We save you in your body, that you may be a Sign to those who come after you; but verily, many of mankind are heedless of Our Signs

And We established the Children of Israel in a secure abode, and We provided them with good things; and they disagreed not until knowledge had come unto them. Verily, your Lord will judge between them on the Day of Resurrection concerning that whereon the
And if you are in doubt of that which We have revealed unto you, ask those who read the Book before you; verily, the truth has come to you from your Lord. So be not you of those who doubt
And be not of those who reject the Signs of Allah, for then you will be of the losers
Verily, those against whom the word of your Lord has been pronounced will not believe
Even though there come to them every sign, until they see the grievous doom

If only there were a community that had believed and profited from its faith. But none did except the people of Jonah. When they believed We removed from them the Torment of Disgrace in this world, and We gave them provision for a while
But had your Lord willed, all who are in the earth would have believed together. Would you force men to become believers
It is not for any soul to believe save by the permission of Allah; He sets uncleanness on those who have no sense
Say, "Behold what is in the heavens and in the earth! But Signs and Warners avail not a people who do not believe
What expect they but the like of the days of those who passed away before them? Say, "Wait you then! Verily, I, too, will wait with you
Then will We save Our Messengers and those who believe, as is fitting to Us, in like manner as before

Say, "O mankind! If you are in doubt concerning my religion, (know that) I will not worship those you worship other than Allah; but I worship Allah, who takes you to Himself, and I have been commanded to be of the believers
And, set your purpose resolutely for religion as a "Hanif" (a man upright by nature); and be not of the idolaters
And call not besides Allah on what can neither profit you nor harm you; for if you do, verily, you are then of the wrong-doers (or unjust)

And should Allah touch you with harm, there is none to remove it save He; and if He wish you well, there is none to repel His grace; He makes it fall on whom He will of His servants; for He is Forgiving and Merciful

Say, "O mankind! There has come to you the Truth from your Lord, and he who is guided by it, his guidance is only for his own soul; and he who errs, errs only against it; and I am not a warder over you
Follow what is inspired in you, and be patient until Allah judges, for He is the best of judges
ALIF LAM RA. This is a Book whose signs (verses) are perfected (confirmed, fundamental and well-established) and then expounded (explained in detail), from the Wise One, the Aware
(Saying,) " Serve (or worship) none other than Allah. Verily, I am unto you from Him a Warner and a herald of Glad Tidings

Seek pardon from your Lord, then turn to Him repentant. He will cause you to enjoy a good provision until an appointed time. He gives of His Bounty (or Grace) to every one deserving it. But if you turn your backs, I fear for you the retribution of a
Unto Allah is your return, and He has power over all things

Do they not, verily, fold up their breasts, that they may hide (their thoughts) from Him? But when they cover themselves with their garments, does He not know what they conceal and what they display? Verily, He knows the nature of menÂ´s heart
